intro: Didissandra glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth didissandra, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by red berries that are edible for some animals. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
